Name: Description
Description: A description of the content and purpose of the segment used. Supports multiple language versions of the same content as well as optional formatting of the content.

Name: ArrayBase
Description: The array base is the value of the designation for the first item in an array and is generally set to either 0 or 1. Unix based systems and most current programming systems use an array base of 0. Traditional codebooks normally set the array base at 1, for example the first data item in a fixed format ASCII file record begins at character 1.

Name: StartPosition
Description: The start position of the first character expressed as an integer.

Name: Length
Description: The length of the segment expressed as an integer.
